Hear the word of the LORD, ye children of Israel: for the LORD hath a controversy with the inhabitants of the land, because <FI>there is<Fi> no truth, nor mercy, nor knowledge of God in the land.
By swearing, and lying, and killing, and stealing, and committing adultery, they break out, and blood toucheth blood.<RF>blood: Heb. bloods<Rf>
Therefore shall the land mourn, and every one that dwelleth therein shall languish, with the beasts of the field, and with the fowls of heaven; yea, the fishes of the sea also shall be taken away.
Yet let no man strive, nor reprove another: for thy people <FI>are<Fi> as they that strive with the priest.
Therefore shalt thou fall in the day, and the prophet also shall fall with thee in the night, and I will destroy thy mother.<RF>destroy: Heb. cut off<Rf><CM>

My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge: because thou hast rejected knowledge, I will also reject thee, that thou shalt be no priest to me: seeing thou hast forgotten the law of thy God, I will also forget thy children.<RF>destroyed: Heb. cut off<Rf>
As they were increased, so they sinned against me: <FI>therefore<Fi> will I change their glory into shame.
They eat up the sin of my people, and they set their heart on their iniquity.<RF>setâ€¦: Heb. lift up their soul to<Rf>
And there shall be, like people, like priest: and I will punish them for their ways, and reward them their doings.<RF>punish: Heb. visit upon<Rf><RF>reward: Heb. cause to return<Rf>
For they shall eat, and not have enough: they shall commit whoredom, and shall not increase: because they have left off to take heed to the LORD.
Whoredom and wine and new wine take away the heart.<CM>
My people ask counsel at their stocks, and their staff declareth unto them: for the spirit of whoredoms hath caused <FI>them<Fi> to err, and they have gone a whoring from under their God.

They sacrifice upon the tops of the mountains, and burn incense upon the hills, under oaks and poplars and elms, because the shadow thereof <FI>is<Fi> good: therefore your daughters shall commit whoredom, and your spouses shall commit adultery.

I will not punish your daughters when they commit whoredom, nor your spouses when they commit adultery: for themselves are separated with whores, and they sacrifice with harlots: therefore the people <FI>that<Fi> doth not understand shall fall.<RF>I will not: or, Shall I not<Rf><RF>fall: or, be punished<Rf>
Though thou, Israel, play the harlot, <FI>yet<Fi> let not Judah offend; and come not ye unto Gilgal, neither go ye up to Bethaven, nor swear, The LORD liveth.
For Israel slideth back as a backsliding heifer: now the LORD will feed them as a lamb in a large place.
Ephraim <FI>is<Fi> joined to idols: let him alone.
Their drink is sour: they have committed whoredom continually: her rulers <FI>with<Fi> shame do love, Give ye.<RF>sour: Heb. gone<Rf><RF>rulers: Heb. shields<Rf>
The wind hath bound her up in her wings, and they shall be ashamed because of their sacrifices.<CM>
